channel.title: 100 errors? crap!
channel.description:
someone help me :mad:
my server has 100 errors
look
^ client.java:3471: class, interface, or enum expected person.stillgfx(gfx, person.absY, person.absX); ^ client.java:3472: class, interface, or enum expected if (person.playerLevel[3] - hitDiff < 0) ^ client.java:3474: class, interface, or enum expected person.hitDiff = damage; ^ client.java:3475: class, interface, or enum expected person.KillerId = playerId; ^ client.java:3476: class, interface, or enum expected person.updateRequired = true; ^ client.java:3477: class, interface, or enum expected person.hitUpdateRequired = true; ^ client.java:3478: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:3484: class, interface, or enum expected public void attackNPCSWithin(int gfx, int maxDamage, int range) { ^ client.java:3485: class, interface, or enum expected for (int i = 0; i <= server.npcHandler.maxNPCs; i++) ^ client.java:3485: class, interface, or enum expected for (int i = 0; i <= server.npcHandler.maxNPCs; i++) ^ client.java:3492: class, interface, or enum expected stillgfx(gfx, server.npcHandler.npcs[i].absY, server.npcHandler.npcs[i]. absX); ^ client.java:3493: class, interface, or enum expected if (server.npcHandler.npcs[i].HP - hitDiff < 0) ^ client.java:3495: class, interface, or enum expected hitDiff = damage; ^ client.java:3496: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[i].StartKilling = playerId; ^ client.java:3497: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[i].RandomWalk = false; ^ client.java:3498: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[i].IsUnderAttack = true; ^ client.java:3499: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[i].hitDiff = damage; ^ client.java:3500: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[i].updateRequired = true; ^ client.java:3501: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[i].hitUpdateRequired = true; ^ client.java:3502: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:3507: class, interface, or enum expected public void playerGfx(int id, int delay) { ^ client.java:3509: class, interface, or enum expected mask100var2 = delay; ^ client.java:3510: class, interface, or enum expected mask100update = true; ^ client.java:3511: class, interface, or enum expected updateRequired = true; ^ client.java:3512: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:3514: class, interface, or enum expected public void stillgfxz(int id, int Y, int X, int height, int time) ^ client.java:3521: class, interface, or enum expected if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")) ^ client.java:3526: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:3531: class, interface, or enum expected public void stillgfxz2(int id, int Y, int X, int height, int time) ^ client.java:3534: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByteC(Y - (mapRegionY * 8)); ^ client.java:3535: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByteC(X - (mapRegionX * 8)); ^ client.java:3536: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.createFrame(4); ^ client.java:3537: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(0);//Tiles away (X >> 4 + Y & 7) ^ client.java:3538: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(id);//Graphic id ^ client.java:3539: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(height);//height of the spell above it's basic place, i thin k it's written in pixels 100 pixels higher ^ client.java:3540: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(time);//Time before casting the graphic ^ client.java:3541: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:3543: class, interface, or enum expected public void stillgfx(int id, int Y, int X) ^ client.java:3550: class, interface, or enum expected if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")) ^ client.java:3555: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:3560: class, interface, or enum expected public void stillgfx2(int id, int Y, int X) ^ client.java:3563: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByteC(Y - (mapRegionY * 8)); ^ client.java:3564: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByteC(X - (mapRegionX * 8)); ^ client.java:3565: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.createFrame(4); ^ client.java:3566: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(0);//Tiles away (X >> 4 + Y & 7) ^ client.java:3567: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(id);//Graphic id ^ client.java:3568: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeByte(0);//height of the spell above it's basic place, i think it' s written in pixels 100 pixels higher ^ client.java:3569: class, interface, or enum expected outStream.writeWord(0);//Time before casting the graphic ^ client.java:3570: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:3572: class, interface, or enum expected public void multiTargetGfx(int id, int targetY, int targetX) { ^ client.java:3576: class, interface, or enum expected if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")) ^ client.java:3581: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:3589: class, interface, or enum expected public int MageAttackIndex = -1; ^ client.java:3590: class, interface, or enum expected public int graphicstimer = 0; ^ client.java:3591: class, interface, or enum expected public boolean cast = false; ^ client.java:3592: class, interface, or enum expected public boolean fired = false; ^ client.java:3593: class, interface, or enum expected public boolean firingspell = false; ^ client.java:3595: class, interface, or enum expected public int fcastid = 0; ^ client.java:3596: class, interface, or enum expected public int fcasterY = 0; ^ client.java:3597: class, interface, or enum expected public int fcasterX = 0; ^ client.java:3598: class, interface, or enum expected public int foffsetY = 0; ^ client.java:3599: class, interface, or enum expected public int foffsetX = 0; ^ client.java:3600: class, interface, or enum expected public int fangle = 0; ^ client.java:3601: class, interface, or enum expected public int fspeed = 0; ^ client.java:3602: class, interface, or enum expected public int fmgfxid = 0; ^ client.java:3603: class, interface, or enum expected public int fsh = 0; ^ client.java:3604: class, interface, or enum expected public int feh = 0; ^ client.java:3605: class, interface, or enum expected public int ffinishid = 0; ^ client.java:3606: class, interface, or enum expected public int fenemyY = 0; ^ client.java:3607: class, interface, or enum expected public int fenemyX = 0; ^ client.java:3608: class, interface, or enum expected public int fLockon = 0; ^ client.java:3609: class, interface, or enum expected public boolean fMageNpc = false; ^ client.java:3611: class, interface, or enum expected public boolean firespell(int castID, int casterY, int casterX, int offsetY, int offsetX, int angle, int speed, int movegfxID,int startHeight, int endHeight, int finishID, int enemyY,int enemyX, int Lockon) ^ client.java:3614: class, interface, or enum expected fcasterY = casterY; ^ client.java:3615: class, interface, or enum expected fcasterX = casterX; ^ client.java:3616: class, interface, or enum expected foffsetY = offsetY; ^ client.java:3617: class, interface, or enum expected foffsetX = offsetX; ^ client.java:3618: class, interface, or enum expected fangle = angle; ^ client.java:3619: class, interface, or enum expected fspeed = speed; ^ client.java:3620: class, interface, or enum expected fmgfxid = movegfxID; ^ client.java:3621: class, interface, or enum expected fsh = startHeight; ^ client.java:3622: class, interface, or enum expected feh = endHeight; ^ client.java:3623: class, interface, or enum expected ffinishid = finishID; ^ client.java:3624: class, interface, or enum expected fenemyY = enemyY; ^ client.java:3625: class, interface, or enum expected fenemyX = enemyX; ^ client.java:3626: class, interface, or enum expected fLockon = Lockon; ^ client.java:3628: class, interface, or enum expected actionTimer = 0; ^ client.java:3631: class, interface, or enum expected if(cast == false && actionTimer <= 0) { ^ client.java:3633: class, interface, or enum expected cast = true; ^ client.java:3634: class, interface, or enum expected firingspell = true; ^ client.java:3635: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:3639: class, interface, or enum expected fired = true; ^ client.java:3640: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:3644: class, interface, or enum expected resetGFX(castID, enemyX, enemyY); ^ client.java:3645: class, interface, or enum expected return false; ^ client.java:3646: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ client.java:3648: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ 100 errors Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .
someone plz plz plz help!!! i need to update my server and make it better but for a reason i cant! and i think its cuz of the errors! :'(

item.title: 100 errors? crap!
item.dc:creator: @Slyte Slyte
item.description:
@Slyte wrote:

You forgot or added a } somewhere.

Read full topic

item.title: 100 errors? crap!
item.dc:creator: @HalfGod HalfGod
item.description:
@HalfGod wrote:

Try either…

  1. Fixing the very first error, that can sometimes make a chain reaction and cause many errors, like you have.
  2. Re-Downloading the source and copying+pasting anything important from your other server.

BTW, pimpscape is better than testscape lol

Read full topic

item.title: 100 errors? crap!
item.dc:creator: @Ark0100 Ark0100
item.description:
@Ark0100 wrote:

client.java:9698: cannot find symbol
symbol : method rules()
location: class client
rules();
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .

How would i go about this? i cant finish it?
what do i do to complete this? (must read rules before moving)

Read full topic

item.title: 100 errors? crap!
item.dc:creator: @bryan_m bryan m
item.description:
@bryan_m wrote:

you added it wrong and dounload source again

item.title: 100 errors? crap!

item.description:
@breaking_the_bridge wrote:

item.title: 100 errors? crap!
item.dc:creator: @rukan85 rukan85
item.description:
@rukan85 wrote:

yes it is because of the errors and i dont think any1 is gonna help u with all 100 of the servers if this happened to me i would just redownload server and copy+paste the character folders and any other folders u need but not the client folder cus it the 1 with errors

Read full topic
